taxon_identification.taxon_hierarchy: family rosaceae;tribe rubeae;genus rubus;subgenus eubatus;section hispidi;species davisiorum;

treatment.other_name: (for its discoverers, hannibal albert, 1899- and tyreeca stemple davis, 1902-)
treatment.description: Very slender trailer with canes about 2 mm. thick; primocanes closely covered with fine setae and glands up to 3 mm. long; primocane-leaves 3-foliolate on very long hispid petioles, subcoriaceous and lustrous; the leaflets narrowly elliptic-ovate, acute, 4-5 cm. long, sharply serrate; racemes slender and lax; the erect nearly prickleless pedicels glandular and up to 5 cm. long, only the lowest leafy-bracted; calyx 5 or 6 mm. long, glandless and prickleless; petals 8-10 mm. long, 2-4 mm. broad.
treatment.habitat_elevation_distribution_or_ecolog: Woods and openings, Preston Co., W.Va.
